intro: Spermacoce macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Spermacoce macrocephala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
